events.originalText: Syrian civil war: The Syrian Democratic Forces launched a successful military campaign to isolate and eventually capture Raqqa, the Islamic State's capital.
events.subtitle: Syrian civil war
events.headline: Syrian Democratic Forces Capture Raqqa, Islamic State's Capital

events.originalText: Tammy Baldwin (pictured) became the first openly gay politician to be elected to the United States Senate.
events.subtitle: Tammy Baldwin
events.headline: Tammy Baldwin First Openly Gay Politician Elected to US Senate

events.originalText: A man committing suicide parked his car on the railway tracks in Ufton Nervet, Berkshire, England, causing a derailment that killed seven people.
events.subtitle: Ufton Nervet
events.headline: Suicide on Railway Tracks in Ufton Nervet, Berkshire Kills Seven

events.originalText: The Kelly Barnes Dam in Stephens County, Georgia, collapsed; the resulting flood killed 39 people and caused US$2.8 million in damages.
events.subtitle: Kelly Barnes Dam
events.headline: Kelly Barnes Dam Collapse in Georgia Kills 39, Causes $2.8M in Damages

events.originalText: Nguyễn Ngọc Thơ was appointed by the junta of General Dương Văn Minh to head the South Vietnamese government, five days after Minh deposed and assassinated President Ngô Đình Diệm.
events.subtitle: Nguyễn Ngọc Thơ
events.headline: Nguyễn Ngọc Thơ Appointed to Head South Vietnamese Government

events.originalText: The B Reactor at the Hanford Site in the U.S. state of Washington began producing plutonium, with the facility later going on to create more for nearly the entire American nuclear arsenal.
events.subtitle: B Reactor
events.headline: B Reactor at Hanford Site Begins Producing Plutonium for US Nuclear Arsenal

events.originalText: As part of their plan to eradicate the Polish intellectual elite, the Gestapo arrested 184 professors, students and employees of the Jagiellonian University in Kraków.
events.subtitle: Intelligenzaktion
events.headline: Gestapo Arrests 184 Professors and Students at Jagiellonian University in Kraków

events.originalText: First World War: Canadian forces captured Passendale, Belgium, after three months of fighting against the Germans at the Battle of Passchendaele.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Canadian Forces Capture Passendale, Belgium in First World War

events.originalText: Red Cloud, a Native American leader of the Oglala Lakota tribe, signed the Treaty of Fort Laramie, ending Red Cloud's War and establishing the Great Sioux Reservation.
events.subtitle: Red Cloud
events.headline: Red Cloud Signs Treaty of Fort Laramie, Ending Red Cloud's War

events.originalText: American Civil War: A Union brigade defeated a Confederate force at the Battle of Droop Mountain in Pocahontas County, West Virginia.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Union Brigade Defeats Confederates at Battle of Droop Mountain

events.originalText: The first story from the collection Scenes of Clerical Life by the English author George Eliot (pictured) was submitted for publication.
events.subtitle: Scenes of Clerical Life
events.headline: George Eliot Submits First Story from Scenes of Clerical Life Collection

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: Two British ships are intercepted by a French squadron, leading to the French seizure of the HMS Alexander.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: French Seize HMS Alexander in Intercept of British Ships

events.originalText: King Henry III of England issued the Charter of the Forest, re-establishing the rights of access of free men to royal forests.
events.subtitle: Henry III of England
